head.title: Computer Associates To Miss Revenue Estimate

hedline.hl1: Computer Associates To Miss Revenue Estimate

abstract.p: Computer Associates International Inc warns that first-quarter revenue will fall short of expectations, to between $1.25 billion and $1.3 billion (S)

block.p: Computer Associates International Inc. (NYSE: CA) warned that first-quarter revenues would be short of expectations, falling in the range of $1.25 billion to $1.3 billion, up from $1.22 billion last year. Analysts had also expected the company to earn 55 cents a share, according to research firm First Call/ Thomson Financial. Earnings-per-share figures are to be reported July 20.

Computer Associates International Inc. (NYSE: CA) warned that first-quarter revenues would be short of expectations, falling in the range of $1.25 billion to $1.3 billion, up from $1.22 billion last year. Analysts had also expected the company to earn 55 cents a share, according to research firm First Call/ Thomson Financial. Earnings-per-share figures are to be reported July 20.
''That's a big miss,'' Paul Rodriguez, C. E. Unterberg, Towbin managing director, told Reuters. Unterberg had expected the company to report $1.6 billion in revenues.
The company blamed a fall-off in European sales, softening in its mainframe business and delays in closing several large contracts.
